result.execSummary:
The defendant Jordan P. Feltz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Huber granted for work, counseling and any other reason the Sheriff will allow.
May serve half of sentence on electronic monitor if allowed by Sheriff.

miscConds.notes: Pay restitution of $158, joint and several with co-defendants.

Pay costs, DNA Surcharge and restitution. If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.
Court will grant expungement if probation is successfully completed.

Submit DNA sample.
Comply with assessments and counseling as deemed appropriate by the agent.
May allow early discharge if agent recommends and probation is successful.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Jordan P. Feltz
Current: 1905 Babbling Brook Road, Stevens Point, WI 54481 United States  (Effective: 08-25-2016)
Prior: 2448 Stanley Street, Stevens Point, WI 54481

Defendant Jordan P. Feltz in court with attorney Eric Sheets. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

9:20 AM Court calls case.
Address is verified.

Atty Cousins states appearances.

There is a plea agreement.
Defendant is pleading to Count 2 and Count 3.
Count 1 is being dismissed and read in

Atty Cousins states plea agreement.
State has filed a restitution summary and has given a copy to Atty Sheets.
Atty Sheets concurs, is free to argue.
Defendant concurs.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST Count 2
Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST Count 3

Court questions Defendant regarding pleas.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Sheets for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charges.
State has complied with victim notification statues.
There are no victims present.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Count 1: Dismissed and Read In
Count 2: Disorderly Conduct
Count 3: Criminal Damage to Property

Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Sheets makes sentencing arguments to the Court, recommends 12 months probation and 30 days jail for reasons stated on the record.
Defendant addresses the Court prior to sentencing.

Court has a number of factors to consider to determine sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
Count 2:
Jail sentence of 60 Days, Imposed and Stayed
Huber granted for work, counseling and any other reason the Sheriff will allow
May serve half of sentence on electronic monitor if allowed by Sheriff
Probation for a period of 18 Months
Conditions:
Perform 30 Hours of Community Service
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge
Submit DNA sample
Pay restitution of $158, joint and several with co-defendants
Comply with assessments and counseling as deemed appropriate by the agent
May allow early discharge if agent recommends and probation is successful
Court will grant expungement if probation is successfully completed

Count 3:
Jail sentence of 60 Days, Imposed and Stayed, concurrent to Count 2
Huber granted for work, counseling and any other reason the Sheriff will allow
May serve half of sentence on electronic monitor if allowed by Sheriff
Probation for a period of 18 Months, cocurrent to Count 2
Conditions:
Comply with conditions of probation as stated in Count 2
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge
May allow early discharge if agent recommends and probation is successful
Court will grant expungement if probation is successfully completed
